item.title: Here are the ten advantages of frequency converters
item.description:
1. Energy saving:

One of the primary advantages of frequency converters is that they can save energy. By adjusting the operating speed of motors to match load requirements, frequency converters can reduce the amount of energy that is wasted during the production process. This not only helps to lower energy costs, but it can also have a positive environmental impact by reducing the amount of greenhouse gas emissions.

2. High precision:

Another key advantage of frequency converters is that they can achieve very precise motor speed control. This is important in many production processes where accuracy is critical. By ensuring that the motor is running at the correct speed, frequency converters can help to improve product quality and reduce waste.

3. Low noise:

Because frequency converters can achieve smooth motor speed control, they can also help to reduce motor noise. This is particularly important in settings where noise levels need to be kept to a minimum, such as in hospitals or other sensitive environments.

4. Soft start:

Frequency converters can control slow motor start-up, which can help to reduce the impact and stress on the motor during start-up. This can help to extend the life of the motor and reduce the likelihood of mechanical failures.

5. Improved motor life:

Frequency converters can control motor speed and load, which can help to reduce mechanical wear and failure. By ensuring that the motor is running at the correct speed and under the appropriate load, frequency converters can help to extend the life of the motor and reduce the need for costly repairs or replacements.

6. Reduced mechanical failures:

In addition to improving motor life, frequency converters can also help to reduce mechanical failures. By monitoring the motor operating conditions and adjusting the motor load in a timely manner, frequency converters can help to identify and address potential issues before they become more serious.

7. Reduced maintenance costs:

By extending the service life of motors and reducing the likelihood of mechanical failures, frequency converters can help to reduce maintenance and replacement costs. This can be especially beneficial for companies that rely on a large number of motors in their production processes.

8. Good stability:

Frequency converters can help to improve the stability of the production process by controlling motor speed and load. By ensuring that the motor is running at a consistent speed and under the appropriate load, frequency converters can help to improve product quality and reduce waste.

9. Strong flexibility:

Frequency converters can achieve multiple operating modes, which makes them highly adaptable to different production needs. This can be especially beneficial for companies that need to produce a variety of products using different production methods.

10. High reliability:

Finally, frequency converters can help to improve the reliability of the production process. By monitoring the operating status of motors in real-time and adjusting control parameters as needed, frequency converters can help to prevent downtime and reduce the likelihood of production delays or other issues. This can be especially important for companies that rely on a continuous production process to meet demand.

item.title: Why You Should Invest in a Vector Frequency Inverter for Your Business
item.description:
Why You Should Invest in a Vector Frequency Inverter for Your Business

In today’s fast-paced and competitive business environment, every penny counts. You need to optimize your operations and minimize your costs in order to remain competitive. One way to do this is to invest in high-quality equipment that can help you save money while improving your overall efficiency. And when it comes to power control, there’s no better solution than a vector frequency inverter.

A vector frequency inverter is an advanced piece of electrical equipment that can control the speed of an AC motor by varying the frequency of the power supply. It’s an efficient and cost-effective way to control motor speed and torque, and it offers a wide range of benefits for your business. Here are just a few reasons why you should consider investing in a vector frequency inverter:

  1. Improved Efficiency: With a vector frequency inverter, you can reduce energy consumption and improve your overall efficiency. By controlling the speed and torque of your motors, you can ensure that they are operating at the optimal level for your specific application.

  2. Greater Precision: Vector frequency inverters offer greater control and precision than other types of inverters, allowing you to fine-tune the performance of your motors to meet your specific needs.

  3. Extended Motor Life: By controlling the speed and torque of your motors, a vector frequency inverter can help extend the life of your motors and reduce the risk of damage from sudden starts and stops.

  4. Reduced Maintenance Costs: With a vector frequency inverter, you can reduce the wear and tear on your motors and other equipment, leading to lower maintenance costs and longer equipment life.

  5. Increased Productivity: By controlling the speed and torque of your motors, a vector frequency inverter can help you optimize your production processes and increase your overall productivity.

  6. Versatile Applications: Vector frequency inverters are suitable for a wide range of applications, including pumps, fans, conveyors, and other types of machinery.

At our company, we specialize in providing high-quality vector frequency inverters that are designed to meet the needs of businesses of all sizes. We offer a wide range of models that are suitable for a variety of applications, and we can help you choose the right one for your specific needs.

So if you’re looking to improve the efficiency and productivity of your business, it’s time to consider investing in a vector frequency inverter. Contact us today to learn more about our products and how they can help you take your business to the next level.

item.title: Application of frequency converter in double girder driving
item.description:
Driving is a kind of lifting equipment widely used in industrial and mining enterprises. However, the traditional driving control system has high energy consumption, high overall equipment failure rate, high maintenance costs, low power factor of the power grid, and poor speed regulation accuracy, which has been difficult to meet the requirements of modern energy-saving, stable and high-performance equipment. Modern frequency conversion technology is applied to driving equipment, which can realize the main circuit contactless control, small starting current, low noise, accurate walking lifting positioning, high production efficiency, low maintenance cost, and complete frequency converter protection functions, which can effectively protect themselves, motors and other components.

Process features

The starting torque is large, and it can quickly accelerate and decelerate, forward and reverse

Multi-speed can be achieved and the speed is adjustable

When heavy load, the start and stop in the middle of the air is normal, stable, and does not slip

It can adapt to long-term frequent start-stop, forward and reverse rotation and jog control

Stepless speed regulation can be realized

The security protection is complete

Application scenarios

Walking mechanism: optional Senkuo SKF 8000 series inverter, the use of one drag multiple control, drag cart and trolley traveling mechanism, 15kW and below standard built-in brake unit, only need to configure brake resistance can achieve fast and smooth start and stop, so that heavy objects move smoothly and safely.

Lifting mechanism: Senkuo SKF 8000 series crane special frequency converter is selected, including special timing control for lifting, open-loop vector control, and the use of brake unit and brake resistance combined with mechanical braking to ensure smooth and reliable lifting with load.

Three-phase vector inverter

Senkuo inverter advantages

The fast current limit function effectively limits the inrush current and prevents frequent overcurrent protection

The powerful overload capacity can fully adapt to long-term frequent start-stop control: 180% rated load 3S

Ultra-fast torque response speed and stable speed accuracy, fast operation, accurate positioning, improve work efficiency

The special control logic of the crane can ensure that there will be no slippage phenomenon when starting and stopping at any position when fully loaded, and the driving operation is safe and reliable

It can reduce the power capacity requirements of driving, reduce the starting current, and improve the power factor of the equipment

Applications

Gantry crane, semi-gantry crane, port container crane, gantry crane

Equipment manufacturing, metallurgy, petrochemical, stone processing, logistics, power plants, mining, building materials, ports

item.title: What are the functions and advantages of the frequency converter?
item.description:
Before the appearance of frequency converters, it was very troublesome to adjust the speed of asynchronous motors, because the speed and torque were not in a straight line. For example, the speed adjustment through the slip head, or the simple step-down speed adjustment, etc., the effect was not ideal. According to the speed formula of the three-phase asynchronous motor, the speed n=60*f/p(1-s), where p is the number of pole pairs, s is the slip rate, f is the frequency of the power supply, as long as it can output a controllable frequency AC power supply, the speed of the three-phase asynchronous motor can be changed smoothly, which is the basis of the working principle of the frequency conversion speed regulator.

There are many advantages of vector inverters, here we select the four most important ones to describe them in detail.

  1. One of the biggest advantages of frequency converter is energy saving.

The most obvious industry is the application of fan and water pump industry. Because the power consumption of the fan and water pump is proportional to the cube of the speed, when the external wind/water consumption is not high, the speed will be reduced by frequency conversion, and the energy saving effect will be obvious. The principle of energy saving in other industries is roughly the same, and energy saving is achieved by reducing the motor speed when it does not need to run at full speed.

  1. It can be soft-started, saving energy and prolonging the service life

When the motor is started directly by power frequency, it will generate 7 to 8 times the rated current of the motor. The increase in current increases the electrical stress of the motor winding and generates heat, thereby reducing the service life of the inverter. And the frequency conversion speed regulation can start at zero speed and zero voltage (it can also be properly increased by torque boost).

  1. The control system is simplified

The variable frequency controller can start at zero speed and accelerate evenly according to the user’s needs, and its acceleration curve can also be selected (linear acceleration, S-shaped acceleration or automatic acceleration). The operating speed can be adjusted at any time according to the needs, and can be changed rapidly according to the process, and the speed change can also be realized through remote control PLC or other controllers.

  1. Reduce mechanical wear and loss

Severe vibration will be generated on the motor or the connected mechanical part shaft or gear when it is started by power frequency. This vibration will further increase mechanical wear and loss, reducing the life of mechanical parts and motors. In the frequency conversion speed regulation, the stop method can be controlled, and there are different stop methods to choose (deceleration stop, free stop, deceleration stop + DC braking), which can reduce the impact on mechanical parts and motors, so that the whole system More reliable, life expectancy will increase accordingly, improve system stability.

item.title: What are the benefits of using a frequency converter?
item.description:
Frequency conversion speed regulation has been recognized as one of the most ideal and promising speed regulation methods. The main purpose of using a general-purpose frequency converter to form a frequency conversion speed regulation transmission system is to meet the needs of improving labor productivity, improving product quality, and improving equipment. The degree of automation, improve the quality of life and improve the living environment and other requirements; the second is to save energy and reduce production costs.

So what are the differences in the benefits of using frequency converters in different occasions? We select the frequency converter according to the process requirements and application occasions and summarize the following points: Frequency conversion speed regulation has been recognized as one of the most ideal and promising speed regulation methods, and the use of general-purpose frequency converters to form the main frequency conversion speed regulation transmission system The purpose, one is to meet the requirements of increasing labor productivity, improving product quality, increasing equipment automation, improving the quality of life and improving the living environment; the other is to save energy and reduce production costs.

So what are the differences in the benefits of using frequency converters in different occasions? We select the frequency converter according to the process requirements and application occasions and summarize the following points:

Fan:

  1. Let the fan save electricity by 15-55%, reduce production costs and increase net profit;
  2. Reduce the starting current of the fan, make the grid voltage more stable, and greatly alleviate the shortage of power supply capacity;
  3. Gentle start, reduce mechanical impact, Extend the service life of equipment;
  4. Reduce noise;
  5. Realize automatic control and process control.

Water pump:

  1. Energy saving, can save electricity by 20%-40%;
  2. Flexible configuration, high degree of automation, complete functions, flexible and reliable;
  3. Reasonable operation, soft start and soft stop, can eliminate water hammer effect, motor The average torque and wear on the shaft are reduced, reducing the amount of maintenance and maintenance costs, and the life of the pump is greatly improved;
  4. The frequency conversion constant pressure speed regulation directly supplies water from the water source, reducing the secondary pollution of the original water supply method and preventing the spread of many infectious diseases
  5. The frequency converter is the core part of the whole frequency conversion constant pressure water supply system. The water pump motor is the output link, and the speed is controlled by the frequency converter to realize variable flow and constant pressure control.

Machine tool:

  1. Short parking time, strong braking ability;
  2. Good linearity of speed setting, small speed fluctuation;
  3. Stepless speed change, different speeds can be selected according to the processing requirements of different materials;
  4. Frequency converter within 50HZ For constant torque operation, it can meet the torque requirements during low-speed machining;

Mixer:

  1. The soft start function of the frequency converter can greatly reduce the starting impact current;
  2. The frequency converter has intelligent protection, and it will automatically stop and record when it fails;
  3. It can be given different parameters in time according to different processes and materials. Speed, improve product quality;
  4. Realize energy saving and consumption reduction through frequency conversion speed regulation. I believe that you have a certain understanding of the advantages of inverter applications, and you are very welcome to come to our company to purchase product specifications that suit your requirements.
